recorderSession.description: Ajax enabled tree in a ScriptContainer with javascript looking up nodes.

header.name: accept
header.value: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg, application/x-shockwave-flash, application/vnd.ms-excel, application/vnd.ms-powerpoint, application/msword, */*

header.name: user-agent
header.value: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50215)

response.responseBody:
HometreeSC4.jsp [goTreeSC4.do]

CreationStatic
tree{pageFlow.tree34 and 35}
runAtClienttrue
actionpostback

Tree Postback Information

Expand: 
Selection: 
This demonstrates two tree within the same tree. Both trees have the same name, so they require a parent ScriptContainer with generateIdScope = "true" so their tagId will become unique. JavaScript at the end finds both the tree generated div and and item div.
